perturbation.original_text: Pursuant and subject to Rule 13d-1(k)(1) promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby agree to the joint filing of the Statement on Schedule 13D to which this Joint Filing Agreement is attached, and any amendments thereto may be filed without the necessity of filing additional joint filing agreements.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant and subject to Rule 13d-1(k)(1) promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby agree to the joint filing of the Statement on Schedule 13D to which this Joint Filing Agreement is attached, and amendments thereto require separate filing agreements for each update.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows amendments to be filed without additional joint filing agreements, consistent with standard SEC practices. The modified text contradicts this by mandating separate agreements for each amendment, conflicting with established regulatory filing procedures under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

perturbation.original_text: The execution and filing of this agreement shall not be construed as an admission that the below-named parties are a group or have acted as a group.
perturbation.changed_text: The execution and filing of this agreement constitutes a tacit acknowledgement that the below-named parties are associated but does not imply any formal grouping.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states that filing the agreement isn't an admission of group status. The altered text implies the opposite - a tacit acknowledgement of association, which could contradict the filer's intent and create legal ambiguity regarding group status under SEC regulations.
